fields.headline: All made up
fields.bodyText: When one boils it all down to the nitty-gritty, it is, in the end, the thought that counts. However, for those entirely devoid of plumptious thought or tingling inspiration, you may be relieved to hear that a stupidly expensive Christmas gift is often greeted just as warmly. A personalised Miller Harris perfume, say - a snip at a mere two grand. Or perhaps a handsome tub of La Prairie Skin Caviar, with its own little runcible spoon? And really now, who could resist a jar of Crème de la Mer's super-swelegant face cream, especially when the silver lid is engraved with your very own initials? Admittedly, a Diptyque candle for every month of the year does smell a little of Christmas Eve desperation. Fortunately, it also smells of Mexican orange blossom, so everyone's a winner. Tip: do be sure to ask the shop assistant to leave the price tag on now, won't you? Face cream £75, by Crème de la Mer, 01730 232566. 8/10 Future Solution £130, by Shiseido, 020-7630 1515. 8/10 La Prairie Skin Caviar £100, from Selfridges, 0870 837 7377. 8/10 Year's supply of candles £330, from Diptyque, 020-7727 8673. 10/10 Bespoke fragrance from £2,000, by Miller Harris, 020-7221 1545. 10/10
